This is all up to you I am afraid. if you can't last hit you are gonna miss the minion. Here are some tips for late game though, where I assume you are having issues.
if he has a shiv, ignore the first 3 minions and go for casters. you should be able to 1 shot any cast minion, so take those. If a canon is there, time your attack so you hit it between autos your ADC is doing so you take it. If shiv is down or didn't take it then you can use the same strategy for the melee minions. 

his is late game, where pushing minion waves are important. No one should wait for you to CS some before they want to shove a wave into the enemy towers.

Also, idk why you are complaining about your ADC. in my experience mid laners with AoEs are much harder to get CS from since they can clear a wave with a push of a button.

Good luck and practice last hitting.  {{sticker:sg-ezreal}}

As a non-support, I have to say there's another side to this argument.

In general, yes, it's nice to let your tank support use his relic process. However (playing Leona when filled) it isn't exactly hard to use your stacks despite allies clearing normally anyways. Just time your attacks right, to hit between the ADCs auto (most games your ADC won't be one-shotting all the melee creeps in the wave, and definitely not the cannon - same goes for mid/top). So sure, I'll make it easier on you when I'm intending to just stick around and waveclear the next wave anyways. 

However, let's say I just made a good trade and forced someone to B. I want to get some tower damage, or start Baron, or roam, etc... Any second extra I need to wait to give a support 24g because they can't time their auto for a relic proc properly is wasted time. So do it at the right time or miss the CS. I know it sucks to sit on unused stacks, but it helps the team more to have your strong mid Laner roam a few seconds earlier, or your strong ADC get a few extra autos on that tower, than it does to give your tank support an extra 24-100g for using a proc or three on melee/cannons.
